questions.question: What is a metamorphosed sedimentary rocks?

explanations.c: Explanation :Coal may broadly be defined as metamorphosed sedimentary rocks of carbonaceous character in which the raw material has mostly been supplied by plants of various groups.

questions.question: The major use of limestone is______

answers.a: Primary source material for manufacture of Portland cement
answers.b: Used in metallurgical industries as flux
answers.d: Used as a source of magnesium

explanations.a: Explanation :Limestones and dolomites find important applications in many industries and engineering practice. Thus, limestone is a primary source material for manufacture of Portland cement and for a variety of limes.

questions.question: What is the hardness of the lignite grade of coal?

explanations.b: Explanation :Lignite is compact and massive in structure with an upper specific gravity of 1.5 and hardness of 2.5 on Mohsâ€™ scale of hardness. Some varieties of lignite may still show to a good extent the traces of original vegetable structure.

questions.question: The highest grade of coal is_____

explanations.d: Explanation :Anthracite is considered the highest grade coal with fixed carbon ranging between 92-98 percent. It has highest calorific value in coals and burns without any smoke, as the volume matter is negligible

questions.question: A civil engineer has to deal with which rock in the majority of cases?

explanations.b: Explanation :Sedimentary rocks cover a great part of the crust of the earth; they make up more than 75 percent of the surface area of the land mass. It is with these types of rocks that an engineer has to deal with in majority of cases. It is therefore, essential for a civil engineer to know as much as is possible about the salient features of these rocks
